channel.title: Projects on Vivien BOGNE
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Vivien BOGNE

item.title: Project VII: Predictive Lead Scoring
item.description: State of art What is lead scoring ? In a nutshell, lead scoring is a methodology for ranking leads in order to determine their sales-readiness, their scoring etc. Why lead scoring is so important ? It helps sales and marketing departments identify which prospects are potentially most valuable to the company and its current sales funnel. It helps: improving the lead-handoff process, increasing lead conversion rate, improving rep productivity, and more.

item.title: Project IV: Create a recommender system for Movies and Benchmark it
item.description: Read the MovieLens dataset. Create 2 model pipelines : 1st pipeline : Load data, Train test split, model training, prediction, evaluation. 2nd pipeline : Load data, cross validation. Benchmark the User based and item based collaborative filtering models using the cosine and pearson correlation similarity metrics. The complete notebook : https://github.com/vivien-DSA/recsys_practice

item.title: Project V: Create a model for Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Creating a translation system from a parallel corpus using OpenNMT which provides optimized tools to perform. With OpenNMT we perform sub Tokenization, training, Translatation, Detokenization and then evaluation of our MT

item.title: Project III: Sentiment Analysis using RNN ( GRU ) and CNN
item.description: In this Demo, we are building a sentiment analysis system for Twitter. The task consists in predicting whether a tweet is positive, negative or neutral regarding its content. We use a GRU and CNN.

item.title: Project II: AWS cloud computing
item.description: Load data on HDFS and S3 then Creating Cluster on EMR, a notebook on Sagemaker Deploy SPARK application on the Cluster

item.title: Project VII: Face mask detector
item.description: Problem statement: This is a project made for our knowledge. Indeed the objective is to learn how to use open CV in order to load images, use a predefine algorithm, infer a model and display. We are building here a face mask detector app. We will do this project using the steps below: Data collection and exploration: Collect or download some images ( with mask and without mask) Data preparation: Prepare those images for a ML or DL algorithm.

item.title: Project I: Flu Shot Learning
item.description: In this challenge, we take a look at vaccination, a key public health measure used to fight infectious diseases. We analyse the different data in order to, firstly, have a better understanding of how these characteristics are associated with personal vaccination patterns, secondly, predict the personal vaccination patterns, and finally, provide guidance for future public health efforts.

item.title: Project VI: Most Dangerous Country in EU
item.description: We are delighted to be able to inform the reader. is France the most dangerous Country in EU? We use crimes statistics from europea.eu website to explain or show the most dangerouns countries in European Union. We used 4 datasets, the Assaults, the number of intentional Homicide, the number of car thefts and one last with the number of the number of robbery. Using chloropleth maps, Tree map, bar chart in PLOTLY, we invalidated the null hypothesis.
